tribe_name: United Keetoowah Band of Cherokee Indians in Oklahoma

awards.description: DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS IN OKLAHOMA TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT ENVIRONMENTAL CHARACTERIZATION OF TRIBAL LANDS, POLLUTION PREVENTION, RECYCLING, AND CONTINUE TO BUILD CAPACITY OF ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF THROUGH ATTENDING TRAININGS AND MEETINGS.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, ANNUAL FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT, QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS AND GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEMS, THE INTENDED BENEFICIARY IS THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND CHEROKEE INDIANS IN OKLAHOMA.
DIST. FOR CRRSA HIGHWAY INFRASTRUCTURE PROGRAM FUNDING. ELIGIBLE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THOSE ACTIVITIES THAT ARE ALSO ELIGIBLE UNDER THE TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AS DESCRIBED IN 23 USC 202.
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) CR1 (17.53%) DISTRIBUTION

DISTS. FOR SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FY 21 CR1 (19.73%) TPA BASE AND SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FOR TPA BASE AT 80.27% OF THE CR ANNUAL RATE OF OPERATIONS OF THE TRIBAL PRIORITY ALLOCATION (TPA) PROGRAMS.

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development

awards.description:
DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL LANDS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA. THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, UTILIZE AIR MONITORING PLAN TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE AIR POLLUTANT EQUIPMENT AND LOCATION SITE, PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 AUTHORITY INCLUDING: 1) TO SUPPORT THE TRIBAL AIR STAFF'S CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH TRAINING, 2) DETERMINE LOGISTICAL NEEDS TO CONDUCT AN AMBIENT AIR QUALITY MONITORING, 3) CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS ON RESIDENTIAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENT BUILDINGS, AND 4) PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF AN AIR MONITORING SITE-LOCATION PLAN, REPORTS FOR INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS ON TWO RESIDENTIAL HOMES AND ONE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT BUILDING, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, UTILIZE AN AIR MONITORING PLAN TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE AIR POLLUTANT EQUIPMENT AND LOCATION SITE(S), ABILITY TO NETWORK WITH OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL PROFESSIONALS THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, CONDUCT INDOOR AIR QUALITY ASSESSMENTS, AND RAISE AWARENESS OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF THE UNITED KEETOOWAH BAND OF CHEROKEE INDIANS.
